posts._title: Ruy Guerra – Os Fuzis AKA The Guns (1964)
posts.title: Os Fuzis
posts.excerpt: In an extremely poor region in the Northeast of Brazil, a group of soldiers try to stop the population from sacking a food deposit.

posts._title: Henry King – Little Old New York (1940)
posts.title: Little Old New York
posts.excerpt: Quote:In the 1800s, American inventor Robert Fulton (Richard Greene) travels from Europe to New York intent on building a steamboat that will revolutionize river travel between waterfront boroughs, but instead gets a rude welcome from a vicious shipyard boss at a local tavern owned by salty beauty Pat O’Day (Alice Faye). Pat takes a shine …

posts._title: Marc Lobet – Meurtres à domicile AKA The Apartment Murders (1982)
posts.title: Meurtres à domicile
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘Based on the novel “Hotel Meuble” by Thomas Owen, this suspense thriller has a female police inspector Aurelia Maudru living in a baroque apartment house in Brussels, the site of a nasty murder. All the inspector’s neighbors are suspects in the case, and she is hard-put to ferret out the reasons for the foul deed …

posts._title: Janusz Morgenstern – Zólty szalik AKA The Yellow Scarf (2000)
posts.title: Zólty szalik
posts.excerpt: The Yellow Scarf is a film by Janusz Morgenstern from 2000. Janusz Gajos plays its protaganist, a man fighting with alcoholism, and is proof that television productions do not have to be worse than feature films. The protagonist – a middle-aged man at the top of his career – does not have a name, nor …

posts.title: Big Brown Eyes
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Dan Barr is a flatfoot on the trail of jewel robbers. Eve Fallon is his girl of 5 years. We meet them spitting and sparring, but never doubting they’re in love. Eve is a manicurist, with an eye for news. Soon after we meet her, she’s out of the beauty salon and into the news-room …

posts._title: Bohdan Poreba – Droga na zachód AKA Road to the West (1961)
posts.title: Droga na zachód
posts.excerpt: Quote:During the last days of WWII, an old railroad worker and his assistant guide a train liaded with explosives to the Western front. The journey is a perilous trek through rough terrain, occupied by ruthless German soldiers, desparate deserters, and dangerous gangs seeking easy money.

posts._title: Albertina Carri – La rabia AKA Anger (2008)
posts.title: La rabia
posts.excerpt: Quote:Life in the Argentine pampas is nasty, brutish and short, judging by the intense, compelling drama “La Rabia.” Impressive if challenging-to-watch work by helmer Albertina Carri (“Los rubios,” “Geminis”) observes adultery, violence and animal slaughter largely through the eyes of two disturbed children, while use of jagged animation and luminous landscape shots transmutes the base …

posts._title: Werner Herzog – Glocken aus der Tiefe AKA Bells from the Deep (1993)
posts.title: Glocken aus der Tiefe
posts.excerpt: Quote:Bells From The Deep is a fabulous look at the faith and superstitions of human beings living in Russia and Siberia. Herzog quietly observes his subjects and never appears obtrusive. The camera of Jorg Schmit-Reitwen (Heart of Glass, Kaspar Hauser) captures many incredible moments as Herzog and crew move from one subject to another with …

posts._title: John Paddy Carstairs – Sleeping Car to Trieste (1948)
posts.title: Sleeping Car to Trieste
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Espionage agents Valya (Jean Kent) and Zurta (Albert Lieven) break into an embassy in Paris to steal a diary filled with crucial political secrets. The spies pass the diary on to accomplice Karl (Bonar Colleano) — who then double crosses them, fleeing on the Orient Express to sell it abroad. The agents go after Karl …
